docs.title: C61 leds
docs.text: LEDS on the C61 are accessed through spi

docs.title: Visual Studio Code
docs.text: You can get help with markdown and get preview here as well with plugins:

docs.title: PlantUML VS Code plugin
docs.text:
1. In jebbs.plantuml plugin setting set plantuml.server to http://anansi.setekgroup.local:8081
  2. Allow http on localhost if you get a warning about http*

docs.title: PlantUML Diagrams
docs.text:
PlantUML can be used to generated diagrams

Example

@startuml
"Documentation Writer" as writer
"Read documentation " as (read)
writer --> (Write documentation)
writer --> (Publish documentation)
:User: --> (read)
@enduml

Rendered as

eed6205f-b385-4ebe-90c5-3d99558dc022

docs.title: Use Own PlantUML Server
docs.text:
mkdocs build need access to server which we run on anansi.setekgroup.local:8081

You can edit the server name in mkdocs.yml and run your own elsewhere, e.g. localhost. but make sure you don't commit changes to this file.

docker run -d --name plantuml -p 8081:8080 plantuml/plantuml-server:tomcat

docs.title: Writing Host Mobility Product Documentation
docs.text: This document describes how to write and publish Host Mobility Product Documentation

docs.title: Get the source
docs.text:
Clone the documentation repo and create a working branch.

git clone git@github.com:hostmobility/documentation.git (push)
git checkout -b doc-work

docs.title: Install tools
docs.text:
Install MkDocs. Install it the first time after cloning. Use a virtual environment:

cd documentation
. venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

Activate the virtual enviroment if you have done the previous step before.

cd documentation
. venv/bin/activate

Use the built-in server

mkdocs serve

Preview your changes.

docs.title: Edit the documentation
docs.text:
Edit the documentation using your chosen editor e.g. vim docs/documentation-howto.md or code docs/

Editing details and setup

docs.title: Deploy the documentation
docs.text:
mkdocs gh-deploy

The documentation is published on hostmobility.github.io/documentation. It shall appear identically as on the local server.

docs.title: Special machines
docs.text: Documentation specific to c61, hmx and more.

docs.title: Generic leds
docs.text:
The system leds are configured and used with the standard Linux LED subsystem https://docs.kernel.org/leds/leds-class.html #hmx

  • hmx-leds
  • c61-leds
  • [[hmx-leds]]

docs.title: The following leds are available on HMX
docs.text: Name red:func :pwr_out_led_2 :pwr_out_buzzer green:gps red:gps red:wlan green:func mmc2:: green:wan blue:indicator :pwr_out_equipment yellow:power red:wan red:indicator green:wlan green:indicator :pwr_out_led_1 mmc1:: :pwr_out_active mmc0::

docs.title: Using PlantUML to create UML diagrams from text
Example
docs.text: 3fcc6222-f371-4afd-8c90-5fd000c1a0e4

docs.title: Run local plantuml server
docs.text:
docker run -d --name plantuml -p 8081:8080 plantuml/plantuml-server:tomcat

To test out, go to http://localhost:8081

docs.title: Obsidian
docs.text:
• Install plugin plantuml
  • Set server url to http://localhost:8081

docs.title: Visual Studio Code
docs.text:
• Install PlantUML VS Code plugin
  • In jebbs.plantuml plugin setting set plantuml.server to http://localhost:8080
  • Allow http on localhost

docs.title: Mkdocs
docs.text:
mkdir
mkdocs new .

site_name: My Docs
plugins:
    - plantuml:
        puml_url: http://localhost:8080

rm -r mkdocs-venv; virtualenv mkdocs-venv; . mkdocs-venv/bin/activate; pip install mkdocs==1.5.3 mkdocs-puml ; mkdocs serve
